modules.description: This module renders structured data trees into compact textual representations without introducing additional spacing or line breaks beyond those explicitly defined in the input or through `Custom` nodes. It operates directly on the `Easy_format.t` tree structure, providing output functions to buffers, strings, channels, and formatters. Use it to generate minified or tightly formatted output from structured markup, such as JSON or custom configuration formats.

This module provides functions for rendering structured data as formatted output with customizable styles and escaping. It works with trees of type `Easy_format.t`, composed of nodes representing text, groups, and indentation. Concrete use cases include generating properly indented code, pretty-printing JSON or XML structures, and producing styled terminal output with colors or formatting.

This module formats structured data with precise control over indentation, line breaks, and styling. It works with a tree structure composed of atoms, lists with customizable separators and brackets, and labeled elements. Concrete use cases include pretty-printing JSON or XML with consistent indentation, generating syntax-highlighted code output, and rendering terminal messages with custom styles like colors or bold text.
